IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: Santa Catalina is an Independent School for Grades Pre-K through 12 whose Mission Statement is: Excellence. Spirituality. Responsibility. Service. Santa Catalina School exists to develop in each student a striving for excellence, a maturing awareness of moral and spiritual values, a sense of responsible purpose, and a determination to serve the world with courage, graciousness, and compassion.
IRS990.MissionDesc: Santa Catalina is an Independent School for Grades Pre-K through 12 whose Mission Statement is: Excellence. Spirituality. Responsibility. Service. Santa Catalina School exists to develop in each student a striving for excellence, a maturing awareness of moral and spiritual values, a sense of responsible purpose, and a determination to serve the world with courage, graciousness, and compassion.
IRS990.Desc: The primary service activity is the furnishing of a formal education to students in preschool through grade 12.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: Summer at Santa Catalina is education for girls entering grades 3 through 9.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part V, Line 4: Intended uses of the endowment fund.
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The School's endowment consists of a number of individual funds established for a variety of purposes, including scholarships, faculty professional growth, technology, and general operations. The School's endowment includes both donor-restricted endowment funds and funds designated by the Board of Trustees to function as endowments.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule E, Line 3 - Racially Nondiscriminatory Policy Publicized
Schedule E, Line 4 - Explanation of Records and Materials Not Maintained
Schedule E, Line 5 - Explanation of Organization Discrimination by Race
Part I, Line 1a: Relevant information in regards to selections on 1a.
Form 990, Part VI, Line 11b: Form 990 Review Process
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE AUDIT COMMITTEE HAS PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITY FOR COORDINATING WITH THE ADMINISTRATION ON THE PREPARATION OF THE FORM 990. THE FORM IS REVIEWED BY THE FINANCE COMMITTEE AND MADE AVAILABLE TO EVERY BOARD MEMBER.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 12c: Explanation of Monitoring and Enforcement of Conflicts
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES MUST APPROVE OR DISAPPROVE ANY TRANSACTION IN WHICH THE SCHOOL IS A PARTY AND IN WHICH ONE OR MORE INTERESTED PERSONS HAS A MATERIAL FINANCIAL INTEREST OR OTHER POTENTIAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST. ANY INTERESTED PERSON HAVING A CONFLICT OF INTEREST OR POSSIBLE CONFLICT OF INTEREST ON ANY MATTER SHALL NOT VOTE ON NOR PERSONALLY INFLUENCE SUCH MATTER. THE MINUTES OF THE RELEVANT BOARD MEETING(S) SHALL REFLECT THAT A DISCLOSURE WAS MADE, AND THAT THE PERSON HAVING A CONFLICT DID NOT PARTICIPATE IN THE DISCUSSIONS REGARDING THE MATTER NOR VOTE ON THE MATTER. THOSE TRUSTEES VOTING ON THE TRANSACTION MUST APPROVE THE TRANSACTION BY A VOTE WHICH CONSTITUTES A MAJORITY OF THE ENTIRE MEMBERSHIP OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES, WITHOUT COUNTING THE VOTE OF ANY PERSON WHO HAS AN INTEREST IN THE TRANSACTION.THE SCHOOL SHALL NOT ENGAGE IN ANY TRANSACTION WITH ANOTHER ENTITY WHICH HAS ONE OR MORE DIRECTORS IN COMMON WITH THE SCHOOL, UNLESS AFTER THE INTERESTED PERSON DISCLOSES THE FACTS OF THE TRANSACTIONS AND THE DETAILS OF HIS OR HER AFFILIATION WITH THE OTHER ENTITY, THOSE TRUSTEES VOTING ON THE TRANSACTION APPROVE THE TRANSACTION BY A VOTE WHICH CONSTITUTES A MAJORITY OF THE ENTIRE MEMBERSHIP OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES, WITHOUT COUNTING THE VOTE OF THE INTERESTED PERSON.ANNUALLY, THE CHAIR OF THE BOARD WILL SEND TO EACH MEMBER OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES, EACH OFFICER OF THE CORPORATION, AND EACH HIGHLY COMPENSATED EMPLOYEE A COPY OF THIS CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AS AMENDED FROM TIME TO TIME, TOGETHER WITH A CONFLICT OF INTEREST DISCLOSURE STATEMENT TO BE COMPLETED AND RETURNED TO THE CHAIR OF THE BOARD.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15b: Compensation Review and Approval Process for Officers and Key Employees
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: COMPENSATION FOR THE HEAD OF SCHOOL AND ANY OTHER "DISQUALIFIED PERSON" UNDER INTERNAL REVENUE CODE SECTION 4958 SHALL BE SET IN CONFORMITY WITH THE SAFE HARBOR PROVISIONS UNDER THE INTERMEDIATE SANCTIONS RULE OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE.THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES SHALL BE CHARGED WITH COLLECTING COMPARABILITY DATA AS TO THE COMPENSATION ARRANGEMENTS FOR SIMILARLY QUALIFIED PERSONS IN FUNCTIONALLY COMPARABLE POSITIONS AT SIMILARLY SITUATED SCHOOLS.UPON REVIEW OF THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE'S COMPARABILITY DATA, THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES SHALL APPROVE THE COMPENSATION ARRANGEMENT FOR THE HEAD OF SCHOOL AND ANY OTHER "DISQUALIFIED PERSON". ANY BOARD MEMBER WITH A CONFLICT OF INTEREST WITH RESPECT TO THE COMPENSATION ARRANGEMENT UNDER DISCUSSION SHALL NOT PARTICIPATE IN THE DECISION ON THAT COMPENSATION ARRANGEMENT.THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES SHALL MAINTAIN CONTEMPORANEOUS DOCUMENTATION WITH RESPECT TO DELIBERATIONS AND DECISIONS REGARDING THE AFOREMENTIONED COMPENSATION ARRANGEMENTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 19: Other Organization Documents Publicly Available
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Upon Request and Available for view on Guidestar.org.
